## Description {#details}

An immutable pass that tracks lazily created <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assumptioncache">AssumptionCache</a></code> objects.

This is essentially a workaround for the legacy pass manager&#39;s weaknesses which associates each assumption cache with <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> and clears it if the function is deleted. The nature of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/assumptioncache">AssumptionCache</a> is that it is not invalidated by any changes to the function body and so this is sufficient to be conservatively correct.

Definition at line 204 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/assumptioncache-h">AssumptionCache.h</a>.

### getAssumptionCache() {#af0c9a679eca493aa32aa7002bf4a50a3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>AssumptionCache &amp; AssumptionCacheTracker::getAssumptionCache (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F)</>}>
Get the cached assumptions for a function.

If no assumptions are cached, this will scan the function. Otherwise, the existing cache will be returned.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/assumptioncache-h/#l00232">232</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/assumptioncache-h">AssumptionCache.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/assumptioncache-cpp/#l00246">246</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/assumptioncache-cpp">AssumptionCache.cpp</a>.

### releaseMemory() {#ad973f1c4fb65d9b52fdebb60d80bd226}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::AssumptionCacheTracker::releaseMemory ()"
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
<a href="#ad973f1c4fb65d9b52fdebb60d80bd226">releaseMemory()</a> - This member can be implemented by a pass if it wants to be able to release its memory when it is no longer needed.

The default behavior of passes is to hold onto memory for the entire duration of their lifetime (which is the entire compile time). For pipelined passes, this is not a big deal because that memory gets recycled every time the pass is invoked on another program unit. For IP passes, it is more important to free memory when it is unused.

Optionally implement this function to release pass memory when it is no longer used.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/assumptioncache-h/#l00241">241</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/assumptioncache-h">AssumptionCache.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
